title: 109_hr3863
content: The "Natural Disaster Student Aid Fairness Act" is the short title of the Act. References in the Act are to the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Act addresses the allocation and use of campus-based higher education assistance. The Act waives matching requirements for institutions affected by Gulf hurricane disasters for academic years 2004-2005 and 2005-2006. It allows institutions accepting affected students to also waive matching requirements. The Secretary has the authority to reallocate funds returned by institutions of higher education for award year 2004-2005 and waive allocation reduction for award year 2006-2007 if an institution returns more than 10 percent of its allocation. Eligible institutions can receive reallocated funds. Eligible institutions of higher education affected by a Gulf hurricane disaster or enrolling affected students in 2005-2006 may receive reallocated excess allocations. The Secretary determines the reallocation process, giving priority to institutions in hurricane-affected areas. Additional waiver authority is granted to carry out this subsection. The Secretary may waive or modify provisions to ensure assistance is received by affected institutions for affected students. Funds available under specific sections of the Act have an extended availability until September 30, 2006 for programs authorized under title IV. The Secretary has the authority to recall and reallocate funds allocated to institutions of higher education for the 2004-2005 award year under specific sections of the Act before they lapse on September 30, 2005. SEC. 3. Emergency Designation under section 402 of H. Con. Res. 95 (109th Congress). SEC. 4. Termination of authority one year after enactment. SEC. 5. Definitions. The term "Secretary" in this Act refers to the Secretary of Education. An "affected student" is defined as an individual who applied for or received student financial assistance under title IV of the Act and meets certain criteria related to Gulf hurricane disasters. The term "Gulf hurricane disaster" refers to a major disaster caused by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita, declared by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. The "area affected by a Gulf hurricane disaster" is a county or parish in Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi, or Texas designated for disaster assistance. The term "institution of higher education" is defined in the Higher Education Act of 1965.
